variant.question: In which sectors are the conditions most likely to cause an occurrence of a low level windshear?

options.text: 3A and 3C.
3B and 3C.
3B and 3D.
3A and 3B.

variant.question: An important characteristic of windshear is that

options.text: it is an atmospheric condition that may be associated with a low level temperature inversion, a jet stream or a frontal zone.
it is an atmospheric condition that is associated exclusively with zones of convergence.
it is encountered most frequently near mountain waves during winter months.
it only occurs with jet streams.

variant.question: One of the main characteristics of windshear is that it

options.text: can occur at any altitude in both the vertical and horizontal planes.
can occur at any altitude and only in the horizontal plane.
occurs only at a low altitude (2 000 ft) and never in the horizontal plane.
occurs only at a low altitude (2 000 ft) and never in the vertical plane.

variant.question:
Refer to figure 050-23.
In which sectors are the conditions most likely to cause an occurrence of a low level windshear?

options.text: 3A and 3C.
3A and 3B.
3B and 3C.
3B and 3D.

variant.question: Low level vertical windshear can be expected during the night:

options.text: in association with radiation inversions.
in unstable atmospheres.
and early morning only in winter.
and early morning only in summer.

variant.question: Vertical windshear is:

options.text: a change of horizontal wind direction and / or speed with height.
a change of vertical wind speed with horizontal distance.
a horizontal shear of vertical wind.
a change of horizontal wind direction and / or speed with horizontal distance.

variant.question: Vertical windshear is:

options.text: vertical variation in the horizontal wind.
vertical variation in the vertical wind.
horizontal variation in the horizontal wind.
horizontal variation in the vertical wind.

variant.question: The most dangerous low level windshear can be typically encountered

options.text: when strong ground inversions are present or near thunderstorms.
during any period when wind speed is greater than 35 kts and near valleys.
in areas with layered clouds and wind speeds higher than 35 kts.
near valleys and at the windward side of mountains.

variant.question: The most dangerous low level wind shears are encountered...

options.text: when strong ground inversions are present and near thunderstorms
near valleys and at the windward side of mountains.
during any period when wind speed is greater than 35 kt and near valleys
in areas with layered clouds and wind speeds higher than 35 kt

variant.question: Vertical wind shear:

options.text: is measured on a mast in different heights along runway.
is measured on a mast at the same height and on different places along runway.
cannot be measured.
is measured by the wind cone.

variant.question:
The LLWAS (Low-Level Wind Shear Alert System) is a system that is designed to detect low-level wind shear conditions in the local area around an airport.In this situation, 2 such sensors are present. One sensor is in the center of the aerodrome, at an elevation of 150 ft, measuring a 12 kt wind, and another one further NE, at 60 ft elevation, measuring 25 kt.
What is a likely reason for this to occur?

options.text: There are downbursts or strong downdrafts present in the area.
A weak warm front is passing overhead, causing differences in wind speed and direction.
The wind is veering.
A cold front is nearby, causing wind to back.

variant.question: In which squares are conditions most likely to cause the occurrence of low level wind shear?

options.text: 3 A and 3 C
3 B and 3 D
3 A and 3 B
3 B and 3 C

variant.question: What is windshear?

options.text: Windshear is the change of wind velocity over a distance.
Windshear is the name given to wind flowing from the sea to land during the day.
Windshear is another name for a tornado.
Windshear is when a strong shear wind affects an aircraft.

variant.question: Select a true statement about horizontal wind shear:

options.text: A change of the horizontal vector with horizontal distance, determined by two or more anemometers located at the same height along the runaway.
A change of vertical vector with horizontal distance, determined by two or more anemometers located on the same height along the runaway.
A change of vertical vector with horizontal distance, determined by two or more anemometers located at different heights along the runaway.
A change of the horizontal vector with height, determined by two or more anemometers located at different heights along the runaway.

variant.question: Where does wind shear occur?

options.text: At any level in the atmosphere if associated with either a change of wind direction and/or wind speed.
Wind shear of any significance occurs only in connection with jetstreams.
Wind shear occurs primarily at lower altitudes in the vicinity of mountain waves.
Wind shear occurs only when there is a strong temperature inversion, or when the jetstream is associated with a strong depression.

variant.question: Which of the following weather phenomena can indicate the presence of low-level windshear?

options.text: Virga
Patches of fog
Stratus fractus
Altocumulus castellanus

variant.question: Low level windshear is likely to be greatest:

options.text: at the top of a marked surface-based inversion.
at the top of the friction layer.
at the condensation level when there is a strong surface friction.
at the condensation level when there is no night radiation.

variant.question: The windshear is:

options.text: a vertical or horizontal wind velocity and/or wind direction variation over a short distance.
a vertical wind velocity variation over a short distance.
a vertical or horizontal wind velocity and/or wind direction variation over a large distance.
a horizontal wind velocity variation over a short distance.

variant.question: Where does windshear occur?

options.text: At any level in the atmosphere if associated with either a change of wind direction and/or wind speed.
Windshear of any significance occurs only in connection with jet streams.
Windshear occurs only when there is a strong temperature inversion, or when the jet stream is associated with a strong depression.
Windshear occurs primarily at lower altitudes in the vicinity of mountain waves.

variant.question: (Refer to Annex) In which squares are conditions most likely to cause the occurrence of low level wind shear?

options.text: 3 A and 3 C
3 B and 3 C
3 A and 3 B
3 B and 3 D

variant.question: A "windshear" may be defined as a:

options.text: change in wind direction and/or speed, including up draughts and downdraughts.
sudden increase of wind speed of at least 16 kts rising to 22 kts or more.
sudden change in wind direction of 30Â° or more.
vertical change in wind speed greater than 40 kts per 1 000 ft.

variant.question:
The LLWAS (Low-Level Wind Shear Avoidance System) is a system that is designed to detect low-level wind shear conditions around the periphery of an airport. In this situation 2 of these measuring equipment are situated in the vicinity of an aerodrome. One in the center of the aerodrome, measuring at an elevation of 150' a 12 kt wind, and another one further NE, measuring at 60', 25 kt.
What is the reason for that?

options.text: Danger of downburst or strong downdrafts.
The wind is veering.
A cold front causing wind to back.
A weak warm front causing difference in wind speed and direction.

variant.question: Among other things what should a pilot also report when low-level wind shear is experienced?

options.text: Aircraft type.
Wind shear intensity.
Wind shear origin.
Wind shear duration.
